info.title: Cedrom-SNi's API v2
info.description:
IMPORTANT NOTICE: In order for you to be granted access to this guide, your company has signed a formal agreement with CEDROM-SNi Inc. Please read the following notice summarizing your company’s obligations regarding this guide.

RIGHTS TO THIS GUIDE: This Guide, and the rights, titles and interests thereto (including intellectual property rights, such as copyright, patent rights and proprietary trade secrets) are and shall remain at all times the exclusive property of CEDROM-SNi Inc. You shall not acquire any rights, title or interest therein other than the limited licenses expressly set out in this Agreement. You may make copies of the Guide in connection with your licensed use, but you may not distribute such copies outside of your organization.

GRANT OF LICENSE: You are granted a license to the Guide, for the sole purpose of adapting your product to connect to CEDROM-SNi’s systems (the “Scope of the License”), subject to the limitations set out in the agreement with your company.

RENTAL AND TRANSFER: You may not cause or permit the loan, rent, lease, transfer of possession (whether by sale, exchange, operation of law or otherwise), electronic transmission or time-sharing of this Guide. You may not transfer or assign the Agreement nor the Guide to another individual or entity, save with the prior written consent of CEDROM-SNi.

TERMINATION: CEDROM-SNi may terminate the Agreement upon reasonable notice. At termination of this Agreement, for any reason, or if the commercial relationship with CEDROM-SNi has ended, you shall destroy any copy of his guide.

DOCUMENTATION: A Cedrom-SNi account is necessary to use the API. All requests must be made through HTTPS. Plain HTTP requests will fail.

SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION: The following list presents examples of queries using simple and more sophisticated syntax, and describes the corresponding search results that are returned. Can be use with the search text of the controller "/Documents/Search", "/Documents/Search/Simple", "/Documents/Search/InitRange" and "/Queries".
     - "happy hour": contains the exact phrase "happy hour"
     - black & white: contains both "black" and "white"
     - red | green: contains "red" or "green" or both
     - apple & (green | red): contains "apple" as well as "green" or "red" or both
     - bank ! "blood bank": contains "bank", but not "blood bank"
     - public $2 advertisement: contains "public" followed by "advertisement" with a maximum of two words in between
     - investments %2 textile: contains "investments" and "textile" (in any order) with a maximum of two words in between
     - eat+: contains a declension of "eat" such as "ate", "eating" or "eaten"
     - manage*: contains word(s) that begin with the character string "manage" such as "manager", "managers" or "management"
     - shareholders >4: contains "shareholders" more than four times
     - exports @ aerospace: contains both "exports" and "aerospace" in the same paragraph
     - hiring # staff: contains both "hiring" and "staff" in the same sentence

     - AUT_BY=(Reuters | Peter Martin): searches for documents from the Reuters agency or Peter Martin
     - LEAD=mortgage: contains "mortgage" in the lead
     - TIT_HEAD=mortgage: contains "mortgage" in the title, kicker or subhead
     - ILL=fish: contains "fish" in the caption of an illustration
     - Atlantic & LG=brief: searches for brief documents containing "Atlantic" (possible values are brief, short, medium and long)
     - mortgage & PAGE=1: contains "mortgage" on page 1

post.summary: Logs the user in our system and returns the authentication token required to access the other methods.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: The grant type used for the authentication. It will always be password.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the account you want to connect with.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the account you want to connect with.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending a HTTP form encoded message (Base 64). Only x-www-form-urlencoded is supported.

200.description: The user has successfully logged into our system and the authentication token is returned.

access_token.description: The token used to access any method of the API.

token_type.description: The type of token used for authenticating on the API. Will always be "bearer".

expires_in.description: The time before the token expires. The token can also expire before this if it stays inactive for too long.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

403.description: The user does not have access to the API.

500.description: An internal server error has happened. If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the document matching the document Id.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: The Id of the document you wish to get.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the document is returned.

documentContent.description: The content of the requested document returned as JSON.

AttachmentFile.description: API route to display the atttachment file.

AttachmentUrl.description: API route to display the atttachment file URL.

AttachmentThumbnail.description: API route to display the atttachment thumbnail.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

403.description: The document is not available to this user whether be it temporarily or permanently.

404.description: The document could not be found or is unavailable at the moment.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the search result returned by the search based on the query id.

parameters.name: searchQueryId
parameters.description: The Id of the search query from which the search result must be retreived.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum count of documents to return.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the order in which the documents should be sorted. Possible values are: relevance, date

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the search results are returned.

publicationName.description: The name of the publication containing the document.

byLine.description: The by line that should contain the author's name(s).

title.description: The title of the document that could be used as display.

publicationDate.description: The date at which the document was published.

availableDate.description: The date at which the document is available.

publicationCode.description: The code of the publication containing the document.

inContext.description: The section of the document that was marked by the search.

document.description: The uri from which you can access the html formatted document.
The api uri from which you can access the detailed document.

404.description: The search query id could not be found in the database.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the search result returned by the search based on some text and a number of days.

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: The text to search in the documents' title or content. See section "SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION" for documentation.

parameters.name: numberOfDays
parameters.description: The number of days to include in the search. Use 0 to search only for the documents that came out today.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum count of documents to return.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the order in which the documents should be sorted. Possible values are: relevance, date

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the search results are returned.

publicationName.description: The name of the publication containing the document.

byLine.description: The by line that should contain the author's name(s).

title.description: The title of the document that could be used as display.

publicationDate.description: The date at which the document was published.

availableDate.description: The date at which the document is available.

publicationCode.description: The code of the publication containing the document.

inContext.description: The section of the document that was marked by the search.

get.summary: Gets the search result returned by the search based on a bunch of parameters.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query used to search in our system. See section "SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION" for documentation.

parameters.name: documentBase
parameters.description: The document base which determines which type of documents will be returned. The available document bases are News, Companies and Biographies. If not specified, News will be used.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain used to restrain the search's range. See "/Domains" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be included in the search. If this parameter and excludes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: excludes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be excluded from the search. If this parameter and includes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum count of documents to return.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: numberOfDays
parameters.description: The number of days, starting from the current date, to include in the search. If not specified, startDate and endDate will be used. Use 0 to search only for the documents that came out today.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date from which the search much start. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The date at which the search much end. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the order in which the documents should be sorted. Possible values are: relevance, date

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

parameters.name: Cs-Language
parameters.description: The header which determines the language in which the details are returned. The available languages are French and English. If the header is not specified or the value specified is not implemented or wrong, the user's default language is used.

200.description: The request was successful and the search results are returned.

publicationName.description: The name of the publication containing the document.

byLine.description: The by line that should contain the author's name(s).

title.description: The title of the document that could be used as display.

publicationDate.description: The date at which the document was published.

availableDate.description: The date at which the document is available.

publicationCode.description: The code of the publication containing the document.

inContext.description: The section of the document that was marked by the search.

document.description: The uri from which you can access the html formatted document.
The api uri from which you can access the detailed document.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the search query id and the document count returned by the search based on a bunch of parameters.
get.description: This method caches the search results on the server and returns an id that allows access to the cached results through the /Range endpoint. The search results are cached on the server for five minutes. If there are no request after five minutes, the query expires. The timer is reset every time the search result are access through the /Range endpoint.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query used to search in our system. See section "SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION" for documentation.

parameters.name: documentBase
parameters.description: The document base which determines which type of documents will be returned. The available document bases are News, Companies and Biographies. If not specified, News will be used.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain used to restrain the search's range. See "/Domains" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be included in the search. If this parameter and excludes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: excludes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be excluded from the search. If this parameter and includes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum count of documents to return.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: numberOfDays
parameters.description: The number of days, starting from the current date, to include in the search. If not specified, startDate and endDate will be used. Use 0 to search only for the documents that came out today.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date from which the search much start. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The date at which the search much end. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the order in which the documents should be sorted. Possible values are: relevance, date

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

parameters.name: Cs-Language
parameters.description: The header which determines the language in which the details are returned. The available languages are French and English. If the header is not specified or the value specified is not implemented or wrong, the user's default language is used.

200.description: The request was successful, the search results are cached on the server and the informations necessary to access the results are returned.

resultId.description: The search GUID used to request search results by page to the API.

documentCount.description: The number of documents matching the search's criteria.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the search result cached based on the cached query id acquired through the /InitRange endpoint.
get.description: The search results must first be cached though the /InitRange endpoint.

parameters.name: queryId
parameters.description: The GUID used to obtain the cached search result.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The index from which the returned search result starts. It cannot be lower than 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The index from which the returned search result ends. It cannot be higher than the total number of documents.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the search results are returned.

byLine.description: The by line that should contain the author's name(s).

title.description: The title of the document that could be used as display.

publicationDate.description: The date at which the document was published.

availableDate.description: The date at which the document is available.

publicationCode.description: The code of the publication containing the document.

inContext.description: The section of the document that was marked by the search.

document.description: The uri from which you can access the html formatted document.
The api uri from which you can access the detailed document.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

404.description: There was no query with the specified id cached on the server. It may have expired or has never existed.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the document attachment matching the attachment id.
get.description: The file, video, audio clip or image is returned as a binary file.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The id of the document attachment you wish to get.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting a streamed file. See the list of supported return types in the response content type.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the document attachment is returned.

schema.type: The response only contains the returned binary data. No other field is returned. The response's Content-Type header indicates the type of data returned.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

403.description: The document and its attachments are not available to this user whether be it temporarily or permanently.

404.description: The attachment could not be found or is unavailable at the moment.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the document attachment url matching the attachment id. (Video/Audio)
get.description: The returned url can be used to view the attachment directly in a browser. This method is only available for videos and audio clips.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The Id of the document attachment from which you wish to get the url.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the document attachment's url is returned.

schema.type: The response contains the url string. No other field is returned.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

403.description: The document and its attachments are not available to this user whether be it temporarily or permanently.

404.description: The attachment could not be found or is unavailable at the moment.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

parameters.description: Date range at which search is restricted. Possible values are: TODAY, SINCE_YESTERDAY, DAYS_3, DAYS_7, DAYS_30, MONTHS_3, MONTHS_6, YEARS_1, YEARS_2, ALL. If not specified, "Date Range" value of search preference from Eureka web site is used.

parameters.name: JSon Body

dateRange.description: Date range at which search is restricted. Possible values are: TODAY, SINCE_YESTERDAY, DAYS_3, DAYS_7, DAYS_30, MONTHS_3, MONTHS_6, YEARS_1, YEARS_2, ALL. If not specified, "Date Range" value of search preference from Eureka web site is used.

publicationDate.description: The date at which the document was published.

availableDate.description: The date at which the document is available.

publicationCode.description: The code of the publication containing the document.

inContext.description: The section of the document that was marked by the search.

document.description: The uri from which you can access the html formatted document.
The api uri from which you can access the detailed document.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the search result returned by the search based on a bunch of parameters.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query used to search in our system. See section "SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION" for documentation.

parameters.name: documentBase
parameters.description: The document base which determines which type of documents will be returned. The available document bases are News, Companies and Biographies. If not specified, News will be used.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain used to restrain the search's range. See "/Domains" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be included in the search. If this parameter and excludes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: excludes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be excluded from the search. If this parameter and includes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum count of documents to return.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: dateRange
parameters.description: Date range at which search is restricted. Possible values are: TODAY, SINCE_YESTERDAY, DAYS_3, DAYS_7, DAYS_30, MONTHS_3, MONTHS_6, YEARS_1, YEARS_2, ALL. If dateRange, startDate and endDate are not specified, "Date Range" value of search preference from Eureka web site is used.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date from which the search much start. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The date at which the search much end. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Lists of fields to show. The available fields are Result, Count and Attachments. You can display multiple fields separated by a comma. If not specified, all fields will be shown.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the order in which the documents should be sorted. Possible values are: relevance, date

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

parameters.name: Cs-Language
parameters.description: The header which determines the language in which the details are returned. The available languages are French and English. If the header is not specified or the value specified is not implemented or wrong, the user's default language is used.

200.description: The request was successful and the search results are returned.

publicationName.description: The name of the publication containing the document.

byLine.description: The by line that should contain the author's name(s).

title.description: The title of the document that could be used as display.

publicationDate.description: The date at which the document was published.

availableDate.description: The date at which the document is available.

publicationCode.description: The code of the publication containing the document.

inContext.description: The section of the document that was marked by the search.

document.description: The uri from which you can access the html formatted document.
The api uri from which you can access the detailed document.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the search query id and the document count returned by the search based on a bunch of parameters.
get.description: This method caches the search results on the server and returns an id that allows access to the cached results through the /Documents/Search/Range endpoint. The search results are cached on the server for five minutes. If there are no request after five minutes, the query expires. The timer is reset every time the search result are access through the /Documents/Search/Range endpoint.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query used to search in our system. See section "SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION" for documentation.

parameters.name: documentBase
parameters.description: The document base which determines which type of documents will be returned. The available document bases are News, Companies and Biographies. If not specified, News will be used.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The domain used to restrain the search's range. See "/Domains" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be included in the search. If this parameter and excludes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: excludes
parameters.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be excluded from the search. If this parameter and includes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum count of documents to return.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: dateRange
parameters.description: Date range at which search is restricted. Possible values are: TODAY, SINCE_YESTERDAY, DAYS_3, DAYS_7, DAYS_30, MONTHS_3, MONTHS_6, YEARS_1, YEARS_2, ALL. If dateRange, startDate and endDate are not specified, "Date Range" value of search preference from Eureka web site is used.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date from which the search much start. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The date at which the search much end. Only used if dateRange is not specified.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the order in which the documents should be sorted. Possible values are: relevance, date

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

parameters.name: Cs-Language
parameters.description: The header which determines the language in which the details are returned. The available languages are French and English. If the header is not specified or the value specified is not implemented or wrong, the user's default language is used.

200.description: The request was successful, the search results are cached on the server and the informations necessary to access the results are returned.

queryRangeId.description: The search query range Id used to request search results by page to the API. To be used by /Documents/Search/Range endpoint.

documentCount.description: The number of document(s) matching the search criteria.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the search result cached based on the cached query id acquired through the /Search/InitRange endpoint.
get.description: The search results must first be cached though the /Search/InitRange endpoint.

parameters.name: queryRangeId
parameters.description: The query range id used to obtain the cached search result. See /Search/InitRange endpoint for details.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The index from which the returned search result starts. It cannot be lower than 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The index from which the returned search result ends. It cannot be higher than the total number of documents.

get.summary: Gets the document attachment matching the attachment id.
get.description: The file, video, audio clip or image is returned as a binary file.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The id of the document attachment you wish to get.

parameters.name: maxHeight
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the maximum height an image should be. 0 indicates the image won't be resized. This parameter is ignored if the attachment is not an image.

parameters.name: maxWidth
parameters.description: (Optional) Indicates the maximum width an image should be. 0 indicates the image won't be resized. This parameter is ignored if the attachment is not an image.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting a streamed file. See the list of supported return types in the response content type.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the document attachment is returned.

schema.type: The response only contains the returned binary data. No other field is returned. The response's Content-Type header indicates the type of data returned.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

403.description: The document and its attachments are not available to this user whether be it temporarily or permanently.

404.description: The attachment could not be found or is unavailable at the moment.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the document attachment url matching the attachment id. (Video/Audio)
get.description: The returned url can be used to view the attachment directly in a browser. This method is only available for videos and audio clips.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The Id of the document attachment from which you wish to get the url.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the document attachment's url is returned.

schema.type: The response contains the url string. No other field is returned.

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

availableDate.description: The date at which the document is available.

publicationCode.description: The code of the publication containing the document.

inContext.description: The section of the document that was marked by the search.

document.description: The uri from which you can access the html formatted document.
The api uri from which you can access the detailed document.

get.summary: Gets a document from a specific folder Id.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The folder Id from which the documents must be retreived.

parameters.name: docRefId
parameters.description: The document Id to retreive.

parameters.name: dateRange
parameters.description: Date range at which search is restricted. Possible values are: TODAY, SINCE_YESTERDAY, DAYS_3, DAYS_7, DAYS_30, MONTHS_3, MONTHS_6, YEARS_1, YEARS_2, ALL

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date from which the search much start. Only used if dateRange is not specified. If this parameter or endDate is not specified, the search's time period will not be restricted.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The date at which the search much end. Only used if dateRange is not specified. If this parameter or startDate is not specified, the search's time period will not be restricted.

parameters.name: docUrl
parameters.description: Indicates that you want an external link to the document with the http(s) protocol you want

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the document is returned.

documentContent.description: The content of the requested document returned as JSON.

AttachmentFile.description: API route to display the atttachment file.

AttachmentUrl.description: API route to display the atttachment file URL.

AttachmentThumbnail.description: API route to display the atttachment thumbnail.

parameters.description: Id of the group of folder in which the folder will be created

parameters.description: Parameters defining a folder.

name.description: Name for the folder to to create

description.description: Description for the folder to to create

parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

get.summary: Gets the user's search queries.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the user's search queries are returned.

queryId.description: The query Id used to make requests to the API.

queryName.description: The search query name that could be used as display.

queryDescription.description: The search query description that could be used as display.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

parameters.name: JSon Body
parameters.description: Data structure containing the parameters of the search query.

name.description: The search query's name that could be used as display.

description.description: The search query's description that could be used as display.

query.description: The query used to search in our system. See section "SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION" for documentation.

documentBase.description: The document base which determines which type of documents will be returned. The available document bases are News, Companies and Biographies. If not specified, News will be used.

domainId.description: The domain used to restrain the search's range. See "/Domains" to get a list of possible values.

includes.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be included in the search. If this parameter and excludes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

excludes.description: An array containing criterion and/or publication ids restricting what must be excluded from the search. If this parameter and includes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Criteria" and "/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

sort.description: (Optional) Indicates the order in which the documents should be sorted. Possible values are: relevance, date

dateRange.description: Date range at which search is restricted. Possible values are: TODAY, SINCE_YESTERDAY, DAYS_3, DAYS_7, DAYS_30, MONTHS_3, MONTHS_6, YEARS_1, YEARS_2, ALL

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The Id of the folder you wish to associate the alert to.

parameters.name: activate
parameters.description: Allow you to specify if the alert will be enabled or not. It overrides the default value configured for the folder's group default value.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the query is created.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the user search domains.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

parameters.name: Cs-Language
parameters.description: The header which determines the language in which the details are returned. The available languages are French and English. If the header is not specified or the value specified is not implemented or wrong, the user's default language is used.

200.description: The request was successful and the user's search domains are returned.

domainId.description: The domain Id used to make requests to the API.

domainName.description: The domain name that could be used as display.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the user's search criteria.

parameters.name: categoryName
parameters.description: The category which determines the set of search criteria returned. The available categories are All, Origin, Type, Language, Frequency, Topic, Source, Package and Coverage.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

parameters.name: Cs-Language
parameters.description: The header which determines the language in which the details are returned. The available languages are French and English. If the header is not specified or the value specified is not implemented or wrong, the user's default language is used.

200.description: The request was successful and all the user's search criteria are returned.

criterionId.description: The criterion Id used to make requests to the API.

criterionName.description: The criterion name that could be used as display.

criterionCategory.description: The criterion category that could be used as display or for sorting.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.

pubId.description: The publication Id used to make requests to the API.

pubCode.description: The publication code used in some searches and in your interactions with our customer support.

get.summary: Gets the publication's details.

parameters.name: publicationId
parameters.description: The Id of the publication from which the details must be retrieved.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

parameters.name: Cs-Language
parameters.description: The header which determines the language in which the details are returned. The available languages are French and English. If the header is not specified or the value specified is not implemented or wrong, the user's default language is used.

200.description: The request was successful and the publication's details are returned.

pubId.description: The publication Id used to make requests to the API.

pubCode.description: The publication code used in some searches and in your interactions with our customer support.

pubName.description: The publication name that could be used as display.

issn.description: The publication ISSN (International Standard Serial Number). Basically, the unique identifier for the publication worldwide.

hasPDF.description: Indicates wether or not the publication is hosted as PDF and can thus be viewed in its original format.

description.description: A brief description of the publication.

startDate.description: The date from which the publication is archived.

endDate.description: The date when the publication stopped being archived. (Null if still active.)

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

404.description: The publication Id could not be found in the database or the user does not have access to the publication.

get.summary: Gets the query matching the query Id.

parameters.name: queryId
parameters.description: The Id of the query you wish to get.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're expecting JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The header telling the server you're sending JSON. Only JSON is supported.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header allowing you to pass your token to access the API.

200.description: The request was successful and the document is returned.

name.description: The search query name that could be used as display.

description.description: The search query description that could be used as display.

query.description: The query used to search in our system. See section "SEARCH QUERY DOCUMENTATION" for documentation.

documentBase.description: The document base which determines which type of documents will be returned. The available document bases are News, Companies and Biographies. If not specified, News will be used.

domainId.description: The domain used to restrain the search range. See "/Queries/Domains" to get a list of possible values.

includes.description: An array containing criteria and/or publication id restricting what must be included in the search. If this parameter and excludes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Queries/Criteria" and "/Queries/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

excludes.description: An array containing criteria and/or publication ids restricting what must be excluded from the search. If this parameter and includes are not specified, all the user sources will be used. See "/Queries/Criteria" and "/Queries/Publications" to get a list of possible values.

dateRange.description: Date range at which search is restricted. Possible values are: TODAY, SINCE_YESTERDAY, DAYS_3, DAYS_7, DAYS_30, MONTHS_3, MONTHS_6, YEARS_1, YEARS_2, ALL

400.description: One or more parameters are missing/incorrect. The reason will be specified.

403.description: The document is not available to this user whether be it temporarily or permanently.

404.description: The document could not be found or is unavailable at the moment.

401.description: The user could not be authentified. The reason will be specified.

500.description: An internal server error has happened.If this keeps happening, please contact our customer support.
